intro: Bladhia glabra, commonly known as the smooth bladhia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Bladhia glabra is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both wet and dry conditions.
